title: David de Gea slams ‘unacceptable’ performance from Manchester United after Newcastle loss
text:
De Gea was not impressed with his side’s performance (Picture: Getty)

David de Gea slammed his Manchester United team-mates for ‘unacceptable’ defending in a shock defeat to Newcastle.

United slumped to a 1-0 defeat at St. James’ Park on Sunday, as Matty Longstaff scored a winner on his debut for the Magpies.

With United now stranded in eighth on nine points, a shell-shocked De Gea called on his team-mates to step up after a woeful start to the campaign.

‘We didn’t create any proper chances,’ De Gea told Sky Sports. ‘We defended well. The team needs to step up.

Longstaff scored a winner for Newcastle (Picture: Getty)

‘We have some big injuries but that’s no excuse. We are Manchester United, we need to keep training hard, fighting and winning games.’

Asked what United needed to improve, De Gea replied: ‘Everything.

‘A lot of things to improve. I don’t know what to say. Keep trying, fighting, improving every day. It’s a hard moment for us.

‘The most difficult time since I’ve been here. I don’t know why, what is happening. Sorry to the fans. We will keep fighting.

‘Come on, we conceded a goal from a corner. That cannot happen. It’s unacceptable. Not just this game, but the whole season has not been good.’

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer defended his players after the game, bemoaning a lack of creativity from his side.

United are stranded in the bottom half of the Premier League table (Picture: Getty)

‘We’re disappointed. We did lack quite a few key players but that’s no excuse,’ Solskjaer said.

‘The players worked hard and ran their socks off but at the moment we’re in a place we’re not used to.

‘Some of the boys lack a little bit of composure and we don’t create enough chances to win a game of football.

‘They stay together as a team but we don’t create.’
